abstract: State Attorney General Andrew M. Cuomo announced he intends to sue a major New York landlord that he says harassed hundreds of tenants in rent-regulated apartments in Queens and Manhattan in a systematic effort to force their departure.
snippet: State Attorney General Andrew M. Cuomo announced he intends to sue a major New York landlord that he says harassed hundreds of tenants in rent-regulated apartments in Queens and Manhattan in a systematic effort to force their departure.
lead_paragraph: New York State Attorney General Andrew M. Cuomo said he intended to sue a major landlord that he accuses of harassing hundreds of tenants in rent-regulated apartments in Queens and Manhattan in a systematic effort to force their departure to create vacancies for higher-paying tenants, The New York Times’s Charles V. Bagli reported.

headline.main: Cuomo to Sue Vantage Properties for Harassment
